results.title: Dream house
results.creator_credit: Sally Pryor and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A dream in which the dreamer imagines she can travel into her own brain using computer animation. This brain has a structure like a house, with each room containing images of personality and personal experience.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sally Pryor and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School

results.title: Dream house
results.creator_credit: John Honey and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Puppets go through the steps of building the Australian “dream house” with disastrous results. The second part of the film examines the many legal pitfalls, and suggestions are made for the wise consumer to follow.
results.description: Puppets go through the steps of building the Australian “dream house” with disastrous results. The second part of the film examines the many legal pitfalls, and suggestions are made for the wise consumer to follow.

results.title: Dread beat and blood
results.creator_credit: Franco Rosso and Arts Council of Great Britain
results.brief_description: A unique combination of poetry, music, and politics is portrayed in this film about black reggae musician Lindsay Kwesi Johnson. The lifestyle of blacks in Britain is shown and the pressures they live under. Johnson is seen giving poetry readings in the recording studio as a black activist.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Franco Rosso and Arts Council of Great Britain

results.title: Drawings that walk and talk
results.creator_credit: K H Frank, Marie Seton, British Film Institute and National Film Archive (Great Britain)
results.brief_description: Traces briefly the history of the animated cartoon. Discusses the purpose of caricature giving an animal a man’s mind and behaviour pattern. Includes excerpts from “Drama Among the Puppets” (France 1908), an Otto Herman treatment (Germany pre 1914), and many others from France, England and America. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: K H Frank, Marie Seton, British Film Institute and National Film Archive (Great Britain)
results.description: Traces briefly the history of the animated cartoon. Discusses the purpose of caricature giving an animal a man’s mind and behaviour pattern. results.title: Drawing with a pencil
results.brief_description: The technique of one of America’s foremost pencil sketchers, Thomas Kautsky, is shown by observing him at work sketching a 17th century cooper’s shop situated between the towns of Rockport and Gloucester, in Massachussetts, USA. The film is designed for use by teachers of art, and will be most useful if previewed by the teacher before use with a class.

results.title: Drawing the line
results.creator_credit: Ian Walker, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Cartoonists Patrick Cook, Bruce Petty and Les Tanner take the audience through the growth of the nation depicted in its cartoons, and compare the attitudes of contemporary and early Australian society. Exploits a rich heritage of political cartooning.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Walker, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia

results.title: Drawing a portrait
results.creator_credit: Eliot O'Hara and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The artist, Eliot O’Hara, is here less concerned with problems of composition and style than with a basic approach to creating a likeness.

results.title: Drat
results.creator_credit: Elizabeth O'Neill, Sarah Watt, Ann Shenfield, Robert Stephenson and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: A bunch of lab rats one night decide to break out and escape from their cages in the laboratory. One brain damaged rat, as a result of receiving shock-treatment, initially resists the call. This claymation reveals in its close yet another fiendish experiment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Elizabeth O’Neill, Sarah Watt, Ann Shenfield, Robert Stephenson and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
